title.narrative: Corporate and Public Sector Accountivility Project

description.narrative: The development objective of the Corporate and Public Sector Accountability Project for Azerbaijan is to strengthen accountability and transparency in financial reporting for the public and corporate sectors in line with international best practices. This restructuring paper seeks approval of a level two restructuring and second extension of the closing date of the project. The second restructuring and extension of the closing date, for a cumulative period of 2.5 years, is needed to complete outstanding activities that were delayed in the earlier years of project implementation and to accommodate the Government of Azerbaijan's request to modify the scope and reallocate funds between components once again to focus on key areas that are important for the Project Development Objective (PDO) achievement. The Bank and Government agreed to cancel activities that are no longer relevant to the PDO. Meanwhile, additional activities with high development impact are being added to better target PDO objectives.

title.narrative: % of total budget expenditures audited, using new methodology, by Chamber of Accounts.
# of new accounting and audit, tax related textbooks introduced at higher education institutes.
# of students successfully passing the various training programs
# of NASBOs issued based on IPSAS and explanatory notes
Number of updated IFRS translated, explanatory notes issued
# of accredited training programs (incl. undergraduate, graduate and vocational training programs)
# of Key budget organizations and Line Ministries using unified automatic accounting system.
Accountability in management of public funds strengthened through improvements in the external audit and internal controls environments
Accounting and auditing profession strengthened through the establishment of training and certification programs and education standards in line with international standards.
Transparency, self-governance and education in the accounting and audit profession improved with the establishment of an Association of Professional Accountants that follows international standards
APAA is capable of preparing new/revised accounting and audit standards when necessary and fully responsible for marking exams written by students under National Accounting Qualification Program
% of items completed in the Strategic Development Plan of the Chamber of Accounts
Charter and other legal documents for the establishment of Association of Professional Accountants of Azerbaijan are prepared and registered with the Ministry of Justice
